title: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
[NO THIS IS NOT ANOTHER "PCKF IS GOING TO DIE!!!11"]

PCKF has been lacking in activity for a few months now...

I was wondering if anyone had any ideas why, or how to stop it.

Thoughts?

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
hmmmmmm, the keen generation is growing up?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

Im not really sure about that one but yes, you are right Globox..

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
Yah, I've noticed that too.. Despite the lack of talk, the amount of Keen projects under work is still satisfying. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
It's been a quiet week..Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
Well this is how it works here and on every forum I know.
Sometimes this place is worth visiting three times a day because there are some interesting discussions and sometimes one visit in three days is more then enough.

This community is small and except for Keen we have nothing with each other in common so that the not-Keen-related subjects almost never goes really deep.

What can you do about it? Start a cool Keen project so that we have something to talk about. That costs time and I don't have it and will not have it any time soon but maybe you have. Other then that keep posting, the more different our opinions are the more we have to talk about.

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
Meh, everyone thinks their community is dying, and dry periods are part of a communities life. There's nothing you can do I don't think, but I also think this community will stubbournly cling to life for a long time to come.

I say we just have as much fun as we can while we can.


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

No way! I'm not leaving that easily!" or something. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
Uh.. hi! I'm back!

I have been sooooooooooooooooooooo darn busy.

Yeah. Um... PCKF's activity?

Someone get me out of going to school, doing chores, and extra-ciricular activities... and PCKF's activity is sure to go up

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

Yeah, but practically speaking; we could:

1) Offer RSS (I live on my RSS, cause I use Google, and thus my teachers can stop me [teacher: "how'dya get there?" Najawa: "Google" "You looked it up?" "No, It's on the Google homepage" "*shrugs"*])

2) Do what Xtra does; have a random fan-art, post, and download...

3) Have a *something Keenish* of the week; e.g. Dopefish. and then have links to dopefish pages. You can also have an archive then.

4) Move the friggin thing to phpBB (Or I can pirate you a copy of Invision 2.0.3) (Best option, minus the Invision, because then you own your host, and can add mods, and other stuff, and edit the PHP. I have used phpBB, and know pretty well how it's compiled, so if you set it up, email me [*myusername*@gmail.com]).

5) Add smilies

6) Remove [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-moon.gif[/img]

7) Accept Donations, and advertise with Google adsense, or any other program.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] Gimmi a good night sleep, and then email me; cause I'll be more alert in the morning.Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Do what Xtra does; have a random fan-art, post, and download...[hr][/quote]
Why do what DOS Classics does perfectly well already? Anyway, this forum will probably be integrated into it eventually.
[quote]Quote:[hr]Have a *something Keenish* of the week[hr][/quote]
Too few sites to link to - we'd end up repeating ourselves quite quickly.
[quote]Quote:[hr](Or I can pirate you a copy of Invision 2.0.3)[hr][/quote]
As far as I know, the PCKF doesn't condone piracy or the discussion thereof. Anyway, why run the risk of getting shut down and having legal action taken against us?
[quote]Quote:[hr]Add smilies[hr][/quote]
We have more than enough as it is.
[quote]Quote:[hr]Remove [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-moon.gif[/img] [hr][/quote]
But that's an amazing smiley! Anyway, you said we wanted more smilies - and we can't go backwards, can we?
[quote]Quote:[hr]Accept Donations[hr][/quote]
We already do, although it's difficult to do so: [url=http://p072.ezboard.com/bpubliccommanderkeenforum.showContributeToCommunityChest]p072.ezboard.com/bpubliccommanderkeenforum.showContributeToCommunityChest[/url]
[quote]Quote:[hr]advertise with Google adsense[hr][/quote]
This has been done before, and not with huge success.

The RSS idea is good, though we'll need to move before it's possible.[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Something to increase PCKF's activity?
content:
It's not that the community is drying up, it's just that the chances are likely that when you joined the PCKF, it was because you saw something great happening here that you liked. (Maybe you saw somebody's Keen cartoon, or heard an MP3 of a Commander Keen remix, or played a customised version of Keen1 with new graphics, and followed a nearby link to this forum so that you could share your thoughts on what you'd just seen/heard with other people.)
At the time, you would have thought "Wow! This place is HAPPENIN'!", not realising that before you arrived it was never this happenin', and it was just that little burst in productivity that attracted you in the first place. So when things naturally started to wind down to their normal pace, you feel as though it's dying - but it's not. It just means that it's now your turn to make something happen.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Good luck!----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!
